title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Points earned:

+1 Written response 2(a) identifies a Boolean expression equivalent to the one included in the first conditional statement in the Procedure section of the Personalized Project Reference.

Consider the Personalized Project Reference and Written Response 2(a) when scoring this point.

  • If multiple conditional statements are included in the Procedure section of the Personalized Project Reference, use the first conditional statement to determine whether the point is earned.

  • The conditional statement does not need to be contained in a procedure to earn this point.

Do NOT award a point if the following is true:

  • The identified Boolean expression does not evaluate to the same value as the expression in the conditional statement for all possible values of the included variables.

+1 Written response 2(b) identifies a strategy for testing the correctness of the procedure and describes how the strategy could be used to test the procedure.

Consider the Personalized Project Reference and Written Response 2(b) when scoring this point.

  • If multiple procedures are included in part (i) of the Procedure section of the Personalized Project Reference, use the first procedure to determine whether the point is earned.

  • Some strategies for testing include (but are not limited to) hand tracing, use of visualizations, use of debuggers, adding extra output statements, and commenting out lines of code.

Do NOT award a point if any one or more of the following is true:

  • A procedure is not identified in part (i) of the Procedure section of the Personalized Project Reference.

  • The response does not apply to the procedure in part (i) of the Procedure section of the Personalized Project Reference.

  • The response identifies a strategy that is implausible, inaccurate, or inconsistent with the program.

+1 Written response 2(c) identifies the subproblem being solved or task being accomplished by the procedure and explains how the procedure is used to accomplish the overall functionality of the program.

Consider the Personalized Project Reference and Written Response 2(c) when scoring this point.

  • If multiple procedures are included in part (i) of the Procedure section of the Personalized Project Reference, use the first procedure to determine whether the point is earned.

Do NOT award a point if any one or more of the following is true:

  • A procedure is not identified in part (i) of the Procedure section of the Personalized Project Reference.

  • The response does not apply to the procedure in part (i) of the Procedure section of the Personalized Project Reference.

  • The response includes an explanation that is implausible, inaccurate, or inconsistent with the program.
descriptions: Total number of points earned is equal to 0.
Total number of points earned is equal to 1.
Total number of points earned is equal to 2.
Total number of points earned is equal to 3.
